intro: Stenomesson acutum, commonly known as the sharpleaf stenomesson, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and sandy soils. Its leaves are narrow and pointed, giving it its common name, while its flowers are small and clustered. Stenomesson acutum is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
